@roblox/globaltype/RunService.Heartbeat.documentation: Fires every frame after the physics simulation has completed
@roblox/globaltype/RunService.Heartbeat.code_sample:
local RunService = game:GetService("RunService")
local loopCount = 5
local count = 0

local connection
function onHeartbeat(step)
    if count < loopCount then
        count = count + 1
        print("Time between each loop: " .. step)
    else
        connection:Disconnect()
    end
end
connection = RunService.Heartbeat:Connect(onHeartbeat)

@roblox/globaltype/RunService.RenderStep.code_sample:
local RunService = game:GetService("RunService")

local guiObject = script.Parent

local degreesPerSecond = 180

local function onRenderStep(deltaTime)
	local deltaRotation = deltaTime * degreesPerSecond
	guiObject.Rotation = guiObject.Rotation + deltaRotation 
end
RunService.RenderStepped:Connect(onRenderStep)

@roblox/globaltype/Seat.documentation: A type of BasePart that characters can 'sit' in. When a character touches an enabled Seat object, it will be attached to the part by a Weld and the default character scripts will play a sitting animation.
@roblox/globaltype/Seat.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")
    
    local seat = Instance.new("Seat")
    seat.Anchored = true 
    seat.Position = Vector3.new(0, 1, 0)
    seat.Parent = workspace 
    
    local currentPlayer = nil
    
    seat:GetPropertyChangedSignal("Occupant"):Connect(function()
    	local humanoid = seat.Occupant 
    	if humanoid then 
    		local character = humanoid.Parent
    		local player = Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(character)
    		if player then 
    			print(player.Name.." has sat down")
    			currentPlayer = player
    			return
    		end	
    	end
    	if currentPlayer then 
    		print(currentPlayer.Name.." has got up")
    		currentPlayer = nil
    	end
    end)

@roblox/globaltype/Seat.Disabled.documentation: Whether or not the seat is usable. If set to true, the seat will act as a normal part.

@roblox/globaltype/Seat.Occupant.documentation: The humanoid that is sitting in the seat

@roblox/globaltype/Seat.Sit.documentation: Forces the character with the specified Humanoid to sit in the Seat.

@roblox/globaltype/Shirt.documentation: Displays a Shirt texture from the Roblox website to display on a Humanoid rig
@roblox/globaltype/Shirt.code_sample:
local function replaceClothes(player)
    	local character = player.Character
    	if character then 
    		-- look for shirts / pants
    		local shirt = character:FindFirstChildOfClass("Shirt")
    		local pants = character:FindFirstChildOfClass("Pants")
    		-- create shirts / pants if they don't exist
    		if not shirt then 
    			shirt = Instance.new("Shirt", character)
    		end 
    		if not pants then 
    			pants = Instance.new("Pants", character)
     		end
    		-- reset shirt / pants content ids
    		shirt.ShirtTemplate = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=83326831"
    		pants.PantsTemplate = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=10045638"
    	end
    end

@roblox/globaltype/Shirt.ShirtTemplate.documentation: Determines the texture of the Shirt. The content ID link pointing to the shirt template hosted on the Roblox website.
@roblox/globaltype/Shirt.ShirtTemplate.code_sample:
local function replaceClothes(player)
    	local character = player.Character
    	if character then 
    		-- look for shirts / pants
    		local shirt = character:FindFirstChildOfClass("Shirt")
    		local pants = character:FindFirstChildOfClass("Pants")
    		-- create shirts / pants if they don't exist
    		if not shirt then 
    			shirt = Instance.new("Shirt", character)
    		end 
    		if not pants then 
    			pants = Instance.new("Pants", character)
     		end
    		-- reset shirt / pants content ids
    		shirt.ShirtTemplate = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=83326831"
    		pants.PantsTemplate = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=10045638"
    	end
    end

constantemente establecido.

@roblox/globaltype/SkateboardPlatform.documentation: A SkateboardPlatform can be used to create a skateboard. When characters get on a skateboard, they are stuck to it until they press the escape key. Until then, the character uses skateboard animations and travels faster than a walking character.

@roblox/globaltype/SkateboardPlatform.St.documentation: The direction of movement, tied to the keys A and D. Must be 1 (right), 0 (straight), or -1 (left). Will refresh back to 0 unless constantly set.
If true, wheels won't roll without user input.

@roblox/globaltype/SkateboardPlatform.Th.documentation: The direction of movement, tied to the keys W and S. Must be an integer 1 (forward), 0 (null), or -1 (reverse). Will refresh back to 0 unless constantly set.

@roblox/globaltype/SkateboardPlatform.Ap.documentation: A SkateboardPlatform can be used to create a skateboard. When characters get on a skateboard, they are stuck to it until they press the escape key. Until then, the character uses skateboard animations and travels faster than a walking character.

@roblox/globaltype/SlidingBallConstraint.documentation: A currently unfinished and unavailable type of constraint.
Sets whether the translation of the PrismaticConstraint is actuated and, if so, what kind of actuation.
The current offset between the SlidingBallConstraint's Attachment.
Sets whether the SlidingBallConstraint will limit the range of translation.
Specifies the sharpness of the linear servo motor in reaching the SlidingBallConstraint.TargetPosition.
The lower position limit along the x-axis of Constraint.Attachment0 for a SlidingBallConstraint if SlidingBallConstraint.LimitsEnabled is true.
The maximum acceleration a SlidingBallConstraint with SlidingBallConstraint.ActuatorType set to Enum.ActuatorType can apply when trying to reach its desired SlidingBallConstraint.Velocity.
The maximum force a SlidingBallConstraint with SlidingBallConstraint.ActuatorType set to Enum.ActuatorType can apply when trying to reach its desired SlidingBallConstraint.Velocity.

How elastic Attachment connected by a SlidingBallConstraint will be when they reach the end of the range specified by SlidingBallConstraint.UpperLimit and SlidingBallConstraint.LowerLimit when SlidingBallConstraint.LimitsEnabled is set to true. Constrained between 0 and 1.
The maximum force a SlidingBallConstraint with SlidingBallConstraint.ActuatorType set to Enum.ActuatorType can apply when trying to reach its desired SlidingBallConstraint.Speed.
The visualized size of the SlidingBallConstraint.

The desired speed a SlidingBallConstraint with SlidingBallConstraint.ActuatorType set to Enum.ActuatorType will attempt to maintain while translating towards its SlidingBallConstraint.TargetPosition. Measured in studs/second.
The target position a SlidingBallConstraint will attempt to translate to if its SlidingBallConstraint.ActuatorType is set to Enum.ActuatorType. Measured in studs.
The upper position limit along the x-axis of Constraint.Attachment0 for a SlidingBallConstraint if SlidingBallConstraint.LimitsEnabled is true.
The velocity a SlidingBallConstraint with SlidingBallConstraint.ActuatorType set to Enum.ActuatorType will attempt to achieve. Measured in studs/second.

@roblox/globaltype/Smoke.documentation: Un emisor de partículas con la estética visual del humo.
@roblox/globaltype/Smoke.code_sample:
local function recurseForFire(object)
	-- Check if we found a Fire object that has no Smoke
	if object:IsA("Fire") and not object.Parent:FindFirstChildOfClass("Smoke") then
		-- Create a smoke effect for this fire
		local smoke = Instance.new("Smoke")
		smoke.Color = Color3.new(0, 0, 0)
		smoke.Opacity = 0.15
		smoke.RiseVelocity = 4
		smoke.Size = object.Size / 4
		smoke.Parent = object.Parent
	end
	-- Continue search for Fire objects
	for _, child in pairs(object:GetChildren()) do
		recurseForFire(child)
	end
end
recurseForFire(workspace)

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.documentation: A Sound is an object that emits sound. Sounds can be placed within a BasePart or Attachment to emit a sound from a particular position within a place or world, or it can be attached elsewhere to play the sound at a constant volume throughout the entire place.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.code_sample:
-- create a part
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Anchored = true
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 3, 0)
part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright red")
part.Name = "MusicBox"
part.Parent = game.Workspace

-- create a sound
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", part)
sound.SoundId = "rbxassetid://301964312" 
sound.EmitterSize = 5 -- decrease the emitter size (for earlier volume drop off)
sound.Looped = true

-- create a click detector
local clickDetector = Instance.new("ClickDetector", part)
clickDetector.MouseClick:Connect(function()
	-- toggle the sound playing / not playing
	if not sound.IsPlaying then
		part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright green")	
		sound:Play()
	else
		part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright red")	
		sound:Stop()
	end
end)

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.IsLoaded.documentation: This property will be true when the Sound has loaded loaded from Roblox servers and is ready to play.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.IsLoaded.code_sample:
local function loadSound(sound)
	-- Has the sound already loaded?
	if not sound.IsLoaded then 
		-- if not, wait until it has been
		sound.Loaded:Wait()
	end
end
loadSound(Workspace.Sound)

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.IsPaused.documentation: This read-only property will return true when the Sound is not playing.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.IsPaused.code_sample:
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", game.Workspace)
sound.SoundId = "rbxassetid://301964312" 
sound.Looped = true

if not sound.isLoaded then
	sound.Loaded:wait()
end

sound:Play()
print(sound.IsPlaying, sound.IsPaused) -- true, false

wait(2)
sound:Pause()
print(sound.IsPlaying, sound.IsPaused) -- false, true

wait(2)
sound:Play()
print(sound.IsPlaying, sound.IsPaused) -- true, false

wait(2)
sound:Stop()
print(sound.IsPlaying, sound.IsPaused) -- false, true

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.IsPlaying.documentation: This read-only property will return true when the Sound is playing.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.IsPlaying.code_sample:
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", game.Workspace)
sound.SoundId = "rbxassetid://301964312" 
sound.Looped = true

if not sound.isLoaded then
	sound.Loaded:wait()
end

sound:Play()
print(sound.IsPlaying, sound.IsPaused) -- true, false

wait(2)
sound:Pause()
print(sound.IsPlaying, sound.IsPaused) -- false, true

wait(2)
sound:Play()
print(sound.IsPlaying, sound.IsPaused) -- true, false

wait(2)
sound:Stop()
print(sound.IsPlaying, sound.IsPaused) -- false, true

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Looped.documentation: This sets whether or not the Sound repeats once it has finished when it is playing.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Looped.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")

Players.PlayerAdded:Connect(function(player)

	-- listen for new characters
	player.CharacterAdded:Connect(function(character)
		-- wait for the head to be added
		local head = character:WaitForChild("Head")

		-- create a sound
		local sound = Instance.new("Sound", head)
		sound.Name = "TestSound"
		sound.SoundId = "rbxasset://sounds/uuhhh.mp3" -- oof
	
		-- loop the sound
		sound.Looped = true
		
		-- listen for loops
		sound.DidLoop:Connect(function(soundId, numOfTimesLooped)
			print("oof! "..tostring(numOfTimesLooped))
		end)

		-- play the sound
		sound:Play()
	end)
end)

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.PlayOnRemove.documentation: When true, the Sound will play when it is removed from the game, by parenting the Sound or one if its ancestors to nil.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.PlayOnRemove.code_sample:
-- create a sound
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", game.Workspace)
sound.Name = "TestSound"
sound.SoundId = "rbxasset://sounds/uuhhh.mp3" -- oof

-- set PlayOnRemove to true
sound.PlayOnRemove = true

wait(3)
-- destroy the sound
sound:Destroy()

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.PlaybackLoudnes.documentation: A number between 0 and 1000 indicating how loud the Sound is currently playing back.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.PlaybackSpeed.documentation: Determines the speed at which a Sound will play, with higher values causing the sound to play faster and at a higher pitch.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.PlaybackSpeed.code_sample:
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", game.Workspace)
sound.SoundId = "rbxassetid://301964312"
sound.Looped = true

sound:Play()
wait(10)
sound.PlaybackSpeed = 3 -- 3x faster
wait(5)
sound.PlaybackSpeed = 0.5 -- 2x slower
wait(5)
sound.PlaybackSpeed = 1 -- default

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Playing.documentation: Indicates whether the Sound is currently playing.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Playing.code_sample:
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", game.Workspace)
sound.SoundId = "rbxassetid://301964312"
sound.Looped = true

print("playing sound")
sound.Playing = true

wait(10)

print("stopping sound")
sound.Playing = false

wait(5)

sound.Playing = true
local timePosition = sound.TimePosition
print("resumed at time position: "..tostring(timePosition)) -- c. 10 seconds

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.RollOffMaxDista.documentation: The maximum distance, in studs, a client's listener can be from the Sound origin and still hear it. Only applies to Sounds parented to a Part or Attachment (3D sounds)

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.RollOffMinDista.documentation: The minimum distance, in studs, at which a 3D Sound (direct child of a BasePart or Attachment) will begin to attenuate (decrease in volume)

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.RollOffMode.documentation: Controls how the volume of a 3D Sound (parented to a BasePart or Attachment) behaves as the distance between the listener and sound's parent changes.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.SoundGroup.documentation: The SoundGroup that is linked to this Sound. Volume and SoundEffects applied to this sound group will pass onto the sound. A sound can only be in one sound group at a time.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.SoundGroup.code_sample:
local SoundService = game:GetService("SoundService")

-- create a sound group
local soundGroup = Instance.new("SoundGroup", SoundService)

-- create a sound
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", game.Workspace)
sound.SoundId = "rbxassetid://301964312"
sound.Looped = true
sound.PlaybackSpeed = 2
sound.SoundGroup = soundGroup

-- play the sound
sound:Play()

wait(10)

-- change the volume
soundGroup.Volume = 0.1 

wait(3)

-- return the volume
soundGroup.Volume = 0.5
 
wait(4)

-- add a sound effect
Instance.new("ReverbSoundEffect", soundGroup)

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.SoundId.documentation: This property is the content ID of the sound file a Sound object is associated with. Once a sound has been uploaded to Roblox the content ID can be found in the uploaded sound’s URL.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.SoundId.code_sample:
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", game.Workspace)
sound.SoundId = "rbxassetid://301964312"
sound.Looped = true
sound:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.TimeLength.documentation: The length of the Sound in seconds. If the Sound is not loaded, this value will be 0.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.TimeLength.code_sample:
local function playForDuration(sound, duration)
	if not sound.IsLoaded then
		sound.Loaded:wait()
	end
	local speed = sound.TimeLength / duration
	sound.PlaybackSpeed = speed 
	sound:Play()
end

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.TimePosition.documentation: Shows the progress in seconds of the Sound. Can be changed to move the playback position of the Sound both before and during playback.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.TimePosition.code_sample:
-- create a sound
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", game.Workspace)
sound.SoundId = "rbxassetid://301964312"

-- set the sound to start at 30 seconds
sound.TimePosition = 30

-- play the sound
sound:Play()

wait(5)

-- jump forwards to 100 seconds
sound.TimePosition = 100

wait(5)

-- jump back to the start
sound.TimePosition = 0

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Volume.documentation: The volume of the Sound. Can be set between 0 and 10. Defaults to 0.5
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Volume.code_sample:
-- create a sound
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", game.Workspace)
sound.SoundId = "rbxassetid://301964312"
sound.Looped = true
sound.PlaybackSpeed = 2

-- make the sound loud
sound.Volume = 2

-- play the sound
sound:Play()

wait(7)

-- make the sound quiet

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.EmitterSize.documentation: The minimum distance, in studs, at which a 3D Sound (direct child of a BasePart or Attachment) will begin to attenuate (decrease in volume)
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.EmitterSize.code_sample:
-- create a part
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Anchored = true
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 3, 0)
part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright red")
part.Name = "MusicBox"
part.Parent = game.Workspace

-- create a sound
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", part)
sound.SoundId = "rbxassetid://301964312" 
sound.EmitterSize = 5 -- decrease the emitter size (for earlier volume drop off)
sound.Looped = true

-- create a click detector
local clickDetector = Instance.new("ClickDetector", part)
clickDetector.MouseClick:Connect(function()
	-- toggle the sound playing / not playing
	if not sound.IsPlaying then
		part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright green")	
		sound:Play()
	else
		part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright red")	
		sound:Stop()
	end
end)

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.MaxDistance.documentation: The maximum distance, in studs, a client's listener can be from the Sound origin and still hear it. Only applies to Sounds parented to a Part or Attachment (3D sounds)

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.MinDistance.documentation: The minimum distance at which a 3D Sound (direct child of a BasePart or Attachment) will begin to attenuate. Effectively, the emitter size.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Pitch.documentation: Deprecated. Sets how high pitched and fast a Sound is when it is played. The greater the integer, the higher and faster the Sound is.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Pause/param/0.documentation: A Sound is an object that emits sound. Sounds can be placed within a BasePart or Attachment to emit a sound from a particular position within a place or world, or it can be attached elsewhere to play the sound at a constant volume throughout the entire place.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Pause.documentation: Sets Sound.Playing to false. This pauses the playback of the Sound if the sound is playing. As Sound.TimePosition is not reset ,when the Sound is resumed it will continue from its previous position.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Play/param/0.documentation: A Sound is an object that emits sound. Sounds can be placed within a BasePart or Attachment to emit a sound from a particular position within a place or world, or it can be attached elsewhere to play the sound at a constant volume throughout the entire place.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Play.documentation: Plays the Sound. Sets Sound.TimePosition to the last value set by a Script (or 0 if it has not been set), and then sets Sound.Playing to true.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Resume/param/0.documentation: A Sound is an object that emits sound. Sounds can be placed within a BasePart or Attachment to emit a sound from a particular position within a place or world, or it can be attached elsewhere to play the sound at a constant volume throughout the entire place.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Resume.documentation: Resumes the Sound. Sets Sound.Playing to true. Does not alter Sound.TimePosition and thus can be used to resume the playback of a sound stopped using Sound:Pause.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Stop/param/0.documentation: A Sound is an object that emits sound. Sounds can be placed within a BasePart or Attachment to emit a sound from a particular position within a place or world, or it can be attached elsewhere to play the sound at a constant volume throughout the entire place.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.Stop.documentation: Stops the Sound. Sets Sound.Playing to false then sets Sound.TimePosition to 0.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.pause/param/0.documentation: A Sound is an object that emits sound. Sounds can be placed within a BasePart or Attachment to emit a sound from a particular position within a place or world, or it can be attached elsewhere to play the sound at a constant volume throughout the entire place.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.play/param/0.documentation: A Sound is an object that emits sound. Sounds can be placed within a BasePart or Attachment to emit a sound from a particular position within a place or world, or it can be attached elsewhere to play the sound at a constant volume throughout the entire place.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.stop/param/0.documentation: A Sound is an object that emits sound. Sounds can be placed within a BasePart or Attachment to emit a sound from a particular position within a place or world, or it can be attached elsewhere to play the sound at a constant volume throughout the entire place.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.DidLoop.Connect.documentation: Objeto que ejecuta funciones conectadas en una incidencia específica.
Conecta la función dada al evento y devuelve un RBXScriptConnection que lo representa.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.DidLoop.Wait.documentation:
Genera el hilo actual hasta que la señal se active y devuelva los argumentos
proporcionada por la señal.

@roblox/globaltype/Sound.DidLoop.documentation: Event that fires whenever the Sound loops. Returns soundId and numOfTimesLooped, giving the contentID of the sound and the number of times looped respectively.
@roblox/globaltype/Sound.DidLoop.code_sample:
local function loopNTimes(sound, numberOfLoops)
	if not sound.IsPlaying then
		sound.Looped = true
		local connection = nil
		connection = sound.DidLoop:Connect(function(soundId, numOfTimesLooped)
			print(numOfTimesLooped)
			if numOfTimesLooped >= numberOfLoops then
				-- disconnect the connection
				connection:Disconnect()
				-- stop the sound
				sound:Stop()
			end
		end)
		sound:Play()
	end
end

local function loadSound(sound)

@roblox/globaltype/SoundEffect.documentation: SoundEffect is the base class that all other sound effects derive from. A SoundEffect can be applied to either a Sound or SoundGroup by being parented to either.

@roblox/globaltype/SoundEffect.Enabled.documentation: Toggles the effect on and off.

@roblox/globaltype/SoundEffect.Priority.documentation: Determines the order the effect will be applied in relation to other effects.

@roblox/globaltype/SoundGroup.documentation: Un SoundGroup se utiliza para gestionar el volumen y los efectos de sonido en varios Sounds a la vez. Sounds en elSoundGroup testamento tendrán su volumen y efectos ajustados por elSoundGroup.
@roblox/globaltype/SoundGroup.code_sample:
local SoundService = game:GetService("SoundService")

-- create a sound group
local soundGroup = Instance.new("SoundGroup", SoundService)

-- create a sound
local sound = Instance.new("Sound", game.Workspace)
sound.SoundId = "rbxassetid://301964312"
sound.Looped = true
sound.PlaybackSpeed = 2
sound.SoundGroup = soundGroup

-- play the sound
sound:Play()

wait(10)

-- change the volume
soundGroup.Volume = 0.1 

wait(3)

-- return the volume
soundGroup.Volume = 0.5
 
wait(4)

-- add a sound effect
Instance.new("ReverbSoundEffect", soundGroup)

@roblox/globaltype/SoundService.RolloffS.documentation: Establece la rapidez con la que se atenúa o «disminuye» el volumen del Sound 3D.

@roblox/globaltype/Sparkles.documentation: Un emisor de partículas con la estética visual de los destellos.
@roblox/globaltype/Sparkles.code_sample:
local Players = game.Players

local function onCharacterSpawned(character)
	local hrp = character:WaitForChild("HumanoidRootPart")
	-- Add sparkles that are colored to the player's torso color
	local sparkles = Instance.new("Sparkles")
	sparkles.Parent = hrp
	sparkles.SparkleColor = character:WaitForChild("Body Colors").TorsoColor.Color
	sparkles.Enabled = true
end

local function onPlayerAdded(player)
	player.CharacterAdded:Connect(onCharacterSpawned)
end

Players.PlayerAdded:Connect(onPlayerAdded)

@roblox/globaltype/SpawnerService.documentation: An internal service that is responsible for the behavior or SpawnLocations. Its functionality is not accessible to developers.

@roblox/globaltype/SpawnLocation.documentation: SpawnLocation, or "spawns" determine where a Player respawns when they die. They can be configured to allow only certain players to use each spawn, using Team. They also control how ForceField are set up for newly-spawned players.

@roblox/globaltype/SpawnLocation.AllowTe.documentation: Allows a Player to join the team by touching the SpawnLocation. When set to true, if a Player character comes into contact with the SpawnLocation, the player's Player.TeamColor will be set to SpawnLocation.TeamColor.

@roblox/globaltype/SpawnLocation.Duratio.documentation: The length of time, in seconds, that a ForceField will be applied to a Player character spawning at this SpawnLocation. If Duration is zero, the ForceField is never created, and it will not trigger the Instance.DescendantAdded or Instance.ChildAdded events.
@roblox/globaltype/SpawnLocation.Duratio.code_sample:
local spawnLocation = Instance.new("SpawnLocation", game.Workspace)
spawnLocation.Anchored = true
spawnLocation.Size = Vector3.new(5, 1, 5)
spawnLocation.Neutral = true -- anyone can spawn here
spawnLocation.Duration = 20 -- ForceField duration 20s

@roblox/globaltype/SpawnLocation.Enabled.documentation: Sets whether or not the SpawnLocation is enabled. When disabled players cannot spawn at the SpawnLocation and the AllowTeamChangeOnTouch functionality is disabled.
@roblox/globaltype/SpawnLocation.Enabled.code_sample:
local spawnLocation = Instance.new("SpawnLocation", game.Workspace)
spawnLocation.Anchored = true
spawnLocation.Size = Vector3.new(5, 1, 5)
spawnLocation.Neutral = true -- anyone can spawn here
spawnLocation.Enabled = true

spawnLocation:GetPropertyChangedSignal("Enabled"):Connect(function()
	spawnLocation.Transparency = spawnLocation.Enabled and 0 or 0.5
end)

wait(5)
spawnLocation.Enabled = false -- transparency = 0.5

@roblox/globaltype/SpawnLocation.Neutral.documentation: Whether or not a SpawnLocation is affiliated with a specific team. This means that any Player, of any Team, can spawn on it if this property is set to true.

@roblox/globaltype/SpawnLocation.TeamCol.documentation: Sets what team the SpawnLocation is affiliated to. If SpawnLocation.Neutral property is false, only Players with the same Player.TeamColor as the spawn's TeamColor will be able to spawn there.

@roblox/globaltype/SpecialMesh.documentation: ElSpecialMesh es un objeto que permite a los desarrolladores proporcionar un estándar plantilla o malla cargada por el usuario a una BasePart.

@roblox/globaltype/SpecialMesh.MeshType.documentation: Determina el tipo de malla que se aplicará a la BasePart SpecialMesh es padre de.

@roblox/globaltype/SphereHandleAdornment.documentation: SphereHandleAdornmentEs una esfera que se puede adornar en una BasePart.
El radio del adorno de la esfera.

@roblox/globaltype/SpotLight.documentation: A light source that emits light directionally in the shape of a cone with a spherical base.

@roblox/globaltype/SpotLight.Angle.documentation: The angle of which the light is shone from the SpotLight.

@roblox/globaltype/SpotLight.Face.documentation: Sets the side of the parent that the SpotLight comes from.

@roblox/globaltype/SpotLight.Range.documentation: The size of the area that the SpotLight will illuminate.

@roblox/globaltype/SpringConstraint.Coil.documentation: The number of coils visualized on the SpringConstraint. This can only be set between 0 and 8.

@roblox/globaltype/SpringConstraint.Curr.documentation: The current distance between the SpringConstantâ€™s Attachment.

@roblox/globaltype/SpringConstraint.Damp.documentation: Damping constant for the SpringConstraint. Multiplied to the velocity of the constraintâ€™s Attachment to reduce the spring force applied.

@roblox/globaltype/SpringConstraint.Free.documentation: Natural resting length of the spring.

@roblox/globaltype/SpringConstraint.Limi.documentation: Sets whether the SpringConstraint enforces a minimum and maximum length.

@roblox/globaltype/SpringConstraint.MaxF.documentation: The maximum force the SpringConstraint can apply on its Attachment.

@roblox/globaltype/SpringConstraint.MaxL.documentation: The maximum separation the SpringConstraint will allow if SpringConstraint.LimitsEnabled is true.

@roblox/globaltype/SpringConstraint.MinL.documentation: The minimum separation the SpringConstraint will allow if SpringConstraint.LimitsEnabled is true.

@roblox/globaltype/SpringConstraint.Radi.documentation: The visualized radius of the spring's coils.

@roblox/globaltype/SpringConstraint.Stif.documentation: The strength of the spring. The higher this value the more force will be applied when the attachments are separated a different length than the SpringConstraint.FreeLength.

@roblox/globaltype/SpringConstraint.Thic.documentation: The visualized thickness of the spring's coils.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGear.documentation: If the game allows gear, StarterGear contains all of a player's appropriate gear. Whenever the Player's character spawns, all of the contents of that player's StarterGear will get copied into the player's Backpack.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.documentation: A container for LayerCollector to be copied into the PlayerGui of Player. Also provides a range of functions for interacting with the CoreGui

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.ProcessUse.documentation: Allows the StarterGui service to process input like PlayerGui and CoreGui do

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.ResetPlaye.documentation: Determines whether each child parented to the StarterGui will be cloned into a player's PlayerGui when that player's character is respawned.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.GetCoreGui.documentation: A container for LayerCollector to be copied into the PlayerGui of Player. Also provides a range of functions for interacting with the CoreGui

Selects the functionality with which the call will interact: a CoreScript must have registered such a string already (if one hasn't, an error is raised)

StarterGui:SetCore("AvatarContextMenuTheme", { 
	BackgroundImage = "",

	BackgroundColor = Color3.fromRGB(111, 145, 242),
	NameTagColor = Color3.fromRGB(0, 0, 200),

	ButtonFrameColor = Color3.fromRGB(15, 24, 65),

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.GetCore/pa.documentation: A container for LayerCollector to be copied into the PlayerGui of Player. Also provides a range of functions for interacting with the CoreGui

@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.GetCore.documentation: Returns a variable that has been specified by a Roblox CoreScript
@roblox/globaltype/StarterGui.GetCore.code_sample:

@roblox/globaltype/StarterPack.documentation: A service-level container whose contents are copied into each Player's Backpack when the player spawns. It is generally used to hold Tools, but is sometimes used to hold LocalScripts to ensure that each player gets a copy.
@roblox/globaltype/StarterPack.code_sample:
local StarterPack = game:GetService("StarterPack")

local function emptyStarterPack()
	for _, child in pairs(StarterPack:GetChildren()) do
		if child:IsA("Tool") then
			child:Destroy()
		end
	end
end

@roblox/globaltype/StarterPlayer.documentation: Un servicio que permite que los valores predeterminados de las propiedades en el objeto Player sean conjunto.

local Players = game:GetService("Players")

@roblox/globaltype/StarterPlayer.AllowCu.documentation:
Describe los niveles de permisos del juego actual en relación con el avatar personalizado
animaciones del sitio web.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterPlayer.AutoJum.documentation:
Establece si el personaje saltará automáticamente al golpear un
obstáculo en un dispositivo móvil.
@roblox/globaltype/StarterPlayer.AutoJum.code_sample:
local player = game.Players.LocalPlayer
local button = script.Parent

local function update()
	-- Update button text
	if player.AutoJumpEnabled then
		button.Text = "Auto-Jump is ON"
	else
		button.Text = "Auto-Jump is OFF"
	end
	-- Reflect the property in the player's character, if they have one
	if player.Character then
		local human = player.Character:FindFirstChild("Humanoid")
		if human then
			human.AutoJumpEnabled = player.AutoJumpEnabled
		end
	end
end

local function onActivated()
	-- Toggle auto-jump
	player.AutoJumpEnabled = not player.AutoJumpEnabled
	-- Update everything else
	update()
end
button.Activated:Connect(onActivated)
update()

@roblox/globaltype/StarterPlayer.DevCame.documentation:

@roblox/globaltype/StarterPlayer.DevCame.code_sample:
local player = game.Players.LocalPlayer

-- Set the player's camera occlusion mode to invisicam
player.DevCameraOcclusionMode = Enum.DevCameraOcclusionMode.Invisicam

Permite que el desarrollador sobrescriba el modo de cámara predeterminado para cada unoplayer si

local player = game.Players.LocalPlayer

-- Set the player's camera movement mode on computers to classic
player.DevComputerCameraMode = Enum.DevComputerCameraMovementMode.Classic

Permite al desarrollador sobrescribir el modoplayer de movimiento de's siplayer está en un
ordenador.

local player = game.Players.LocalPlayer

-- Set the player's movement mode on computers to keyboard and mouse
player.DevComputerMovementMode = Enum.DevComputerMovementMode.KeyboardMouse

@roblox/globaltype/StarterPlayer.NameDis.documentation:
Establece la distancia a la queplayer se verán los nombres de otros humanoides. Si
establecido en 0, los nombres se ocultan.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterPlayer.UserEmo.documentation: Determina si los gestos propiedad del usuario se cargan al cargar avatares.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterPlayer.ClearDe.documentation: Un servicio que permite que los valores predeterminados de las propiedades en el objeto Player sean conjunto.

@roblox/globaltype/StarterPlayerScripts.documentation: A container for objects to be copied to a Player's PlayerScripts when they join a game

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.documentation: Métricas de rendimiento de un juego.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.ContactsCount.documentation: Una medida del número de piezas que están actualmente en contacto entre sí.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.DataReceiveKbps.documentation:
En un juego en red, esto describe aproximadamente cuántos kilobytes de datos hay
que recibe la instancia actual, por segundo.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.DataSendKbps.documentation:
En un juego en red, esto describe aproximadamente cuántos kilobytes de datos hay
que envía la instancia actual, por segundo.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.HeartbeatTimeMs.documentation:
Una medición de la cantidad total detime ella lleva mucho tiempo
Roblox actualizará todos sus trabajos del Programador de tareas, en milisegundos.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.InstanceCount.documentation: Una medida de cuántas «Instancias» hay actualmente en la memoria.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.MovingPrimitive.documentation:
Una medición de cuántos componentes simulados físicamente hay actualmente
moviéndose en el mundo del juego.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.PhysicsReceiveK.documentation:
En un juego en red, esto describe aproximadamente cuántos kilobytes de física
la instancia actual recibe datos por segundo.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.PhysicsSendKbps.documentation:
En un juego en red, esto describe aproximadamente cuántos kilobytes de física
la instancia actual envía los datos por segundo.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.PhysicsStepTime.documentation:
Una medida del tiempo que tarda el motor de física en actualizar su
estado actual, en milisegundos. Si estovalue es alto, significa que
la instancia del juego está bajo estrés por las simulaciones de física que tienen lugar.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.PrimitivesCount.documentation:
Una medida de cuántos componentes simulados físicamente existen actualmente
en el mundo del juego.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.GetBrowserTrack.documentation: Métricas de rendimiento de un juego.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.GetMemoryUsageM.documentation: Métricas de rendimiento de un juego.
Devuelve el número de megabytes que se están consumiendo en el Categoría DeveloperyMemoryTag.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.GetTotalMemoryU.documentation: Métricas de rendimiento de un juego.

Devuelve la cantidad total de memoria que consume el juego actual
sesión, en megabytes.

@roblox/globaltype/Stats.GetPaginatedMem.documentation: Métricas de rendimiento de un juego.

@roblox/globaltype/StatsItem.GetValueStr.documentation: Devuelve losStatsItem'svalue como una cadena con formato.

@roblox/globaltype/Status.documentation: Un objeto inacabado que no ofrece ninguna funcionalidad a los desarrolladores.

@roblox/globaltype/StringValue.documentation: A container object for a single string.
@roblox/globaltype/StringValue.code_sample:
-- Demonstrate the Changed event by creating a Part
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Changed:Connect(print)
-- This fires Changed with "Transparency"
part.Transparency = .5
-- Similarly, this fires Changed with "Number"
part.Name = "SomePart"
-- Since changing BrickColor will also change other
-- properties at the same time, this line fires Changed
-- with "BrickColor", "Color3" and "Color3uint16".
part.BrickColor = BrickColor.Red()

-- A NumberValue holds a double-precision floating-point number 
local vNumber = Instance.new("NumberValue")
vNumber.Changed:Connect(print)
-- This fires Changed with 123.456 (not "Value")
vNumber.Value = 123.456
-- This does not fire Changed
vNumber.Name = "SomeNumber"

-- A StringValue stores one string
local vString = Instance.new("StringValue")
vString.Changed:Connect(print)
-- This fires Changed with "Hello" (not "Value")
vString.Value = "Hello"

@roblox/globaltype/StringValue.Value.documentation: The stored string.

@roblox/globaltype/StringValue.Changed.C.documentation: Objeto que ejecuta funciones conectadas en una incidencia específica.
Conecta la función dada al evento y devuelve un RBXScriptConnection que lo representa.

@roblox/globaltype/StringValue.Changed.W.documentation:
Genera el hilo actual hasta que la señal se active y devuelva los argumentos
proporcionada por la señal.

@roblox/globaltype/StringValue.Changed.code_sample:
local value = Instance.new("StringValue")
value.Parent = game.Workspace

value.Changed:Connect(function(NewValue)
    print(NewValue)
end)

value.Value = "Hello world!"

Conecta la función dada al evento y devuelve un RBXScriptConnection que lo representa.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Always Save Sc.documentation: If set to true, Roblox Studio will attempt to transfer script changes that were made during a Play Solo session to the opened place.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Animate Hover.documentation: If set to true, the hover selection box that is shown when mousing over selectable objects in the Workspace will flash between Studio/Hover Over Color and Studio/Select Color based on the Studio/Hover Animate Speed.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Background Col.documentation: Specifies the background color of Roblox Studio's script editor.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Basic Objects.documentation: Sets the scrolling mode of the Advanced Objects tab in Roblox Studio.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Built-in Funct.documentation: Sets the color of built-in functions and keywords in the script editor.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Camera Mouse W.documentation: Sets how many studs the camera will move forward or backwards when using the mouse wheel.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Camera Shift S.documentation: Sets the speed in studs/sec that the camera moves while holding down Shift with the movement keys.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Camera Speed.documentation: Sets the speed in studs/sec that the camera moves when movement keys are pressed.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Clear Output O.documentation: If set to true, the output will be automatically cleared when game sessions are switched.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Comment Color.documentation: Specifies the color of comments in Roblox Studio's script editor.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.DefaultScriptF.documentation: Specifies the default prompt directory that will be opened when the user activates the Execute Script button in Roblox Studio.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.DeprecatedObje.documentation: If set to true, deprecated objects will be shown in the Advanced Objects window, as well as the Object Browser.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Drag Multiple.documentation:
If set to true, the bounding box of a selection will be used for collision detection while dragging, instead of each individual part being checked.
This makes the dragger perform smoother, but with notably less precision.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Enable Autocom.documentation: When set to true, the script editor and command bar will show an autocomplete menu while writing.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Error Color.documentation: Specifies the color of the wavy underline shown when malformed code is detected in the script editor.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Find Selection.documentation: Sets the highlight color of matches in the script editor's Find Selection operation (Ctrl+F).

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Font.documentation: Specifies the font used in the script editor.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Hover Animate.documentation: Specifies how frequently the hover animation flashes when the mouse is hovering over a selectable object in the Workspace.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Hover Over Col.documentation: Specifies the color that the hover selection box uses.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Keyword Color.documentation: Sets the text color of built-in Lua keywords.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Line Thickness.documentation: Sets the thickness of the Model.PrimaryPart selection adornee. This value is constrained between 0 and 0.05

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.LuaDebuggerEna.documentation: Specifies whether or not the Lua Debugger feature is enabled.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Matching Word.documentation: Sets the highlight color of double-clicked variables in the script editor.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Maximum Output.documentation: The maximum number of lines that can be displayed in the output.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Number Color.documentation: Specifies the color of numbers in Roblox Studio's script editor.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Only Play Audi.documentation: If set to true, audio being played will only be heard if the game window is being focused on.
@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Only Play Audi.learn_more_link: https://developer.roblox.com/api-reference/property/Studio/Only Play Audio from Window in Focus

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Operator Color.documentation: Sets the text color of operator characters in the script editor.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Output Font.documentation: Specifies the font used by the output.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Output Layout.documentation: Sets the layout mode of the output.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.OverrideCoreSc.documentation: If set to true, the Studio.OverrideCoreScriptsDir will be used for CoreScripts in Roblox Studio, instead of the default rbxasset://scripts directory.
The directory used when overriding core scripts. This should point to a clone of Roblox's CoreScript GitHub repository.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.PermissionLeve.documentation: Sets the highest permission level that APIs have to have in order to be shown in the Object Browser. See Enum.PermissionLevelShown for more info.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.PluginsDir.documentation: The directory where local plugins are stored.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Render Throttl.documentation:
Scales how much rendering will be throttled when the game window isn't being focused on.
In practice, this property isn't very well understood, and is probably intended for internal use only.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Respect Studio.documentation: When set to true, Roblox Studio shortcuts will take priority over inputs being captured in the game window.
@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Respect Studio.learn_more_link: https://developer.roblox.com/api-reference/property/Studio/Respect Studio shortcuts when game has focus

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.ScriptTimeoutL.documentation: The time (in seconds) a script can wait to be resumed before timing out.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Select Color.documentation: The color of the selection box used with object selections in the Workspace

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Select.documentation: Sets the color of the Model.PrimaryPart selection box.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Selection Back.documentation: Sets the background color of selected text in the script editor.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Selection Colo.documentation: Sets the text color of selected text in the script editor.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Show Navigatio.documentation: When set to true, the navigation mesh used by the PathfindingService will be visualized.

@roblox/globaltype/Studio.Show QT warnin.documentation: If set to true, certain internal error messages regarding the QT framework that Roblox uses will be shown in the output.

@roblox/globaltype/StudioService.ActiveS.documentation: Reflects the LuaSourceContainer currently being edited (if any)

@roblox/globaltype/StudioService.RotateI.documentation: Determines the degrees by which studio's rotation tool will rotate selected objects each tick

@roblox/globaltype/StudioService.StudioL.documentation: The locale currently in-use by Studio, e.g. en_US.

@roblox/globaltype/StudioService.UseLoca.documentation: Determines whether studio tools will use local space of an object or global space.

Provides a dictionary that allows the display of a class' Explorer window icon

@roblox/globaltype/StudioService.GetUser.documentation: Provides access to configuration of Roblox Studio and allows importing files from the user's file system
Returns the studio user’s userId if they're logged in, otherwise returns 0.
@roblox/globaltype/StudioService.GetUser.code_sample:
-- Can only be used in a plugin

local Players = game:GetService("Players")

@roblox/globaltype/StudioService.PromptI.documentation: Provides access to configuration of Roblox Studio and allows importing files from the user's file system

A list of file types that the user is allowed to select. File types are formatted without a period. For example, {"jpg", "png"} would allow only a JPG or PNG file to be selected. If no filter is provided, the filter is nil and allows the user to select any file type
The imported File. Returns nil if no files were selected, or if the selected file was too large (FileSize greater than 100 megabytes)
Prompts the current Studio user to select one file to add as a File
Provides access to configuration of Roblox Studio and allows importing files from the user's file system

A list of file types that the user is allowed to select. File types are formatted without a period. For example, {"jpg", "png"} would allow only JPG and PNG files to be selected. If no filter is provided, the filter is nil and allows the user to select any file type.
The imported File. Returns an empty list if no files were selected. Returns nil if the user selected one or more files that were too large (FileSize greater than 100 megabytes)

@roblox/globaltype/SunRaysEffect.Spread.documentation: Determines how wide the sun rays will spread out

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceAppearance.documentation: An object that allows developers to override the appearance of a MeshPart with advanced graphics options

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceAppearance.Alp.documentation: Determines how the alpha channel of the SurfaceAppearance.ColorMap of a SurfaceAppearance is used

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceAppearance.Col.documentation: Determines the color and opacity of the surface

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceAppearance.Met.documentation: Determines which parts of the surface are metal and are non-metal

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceAppearance.Nor.documentation: Modifies the lighting of the surface by adding bumps, dents, cracks, and curves without adding more polygons

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceAppearance.Rou.documentation: Determines the apparent roughness across the surface

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.documentation: Container for GuiObjects that are rendered on the surface of a part

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.Active.documentation: Whether or not mouse events will be passed to objects layered below.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.Adornee.documentation: Sets the object that the SurfaceGui is adorned too. In other words, this defines which BasePart the SurfaceGui is attached to.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.AlwaysOnTo.documentation: Determines whether the SurfaceGui will always be rendered on top of other objects.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.Brightness.documentation: Determines the factor by which the GUI's light is scaled when SurfaceGui.LightInfluence is 0.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.CanvasSize.documentation: The size of a 'virtual screen', in 'virtual pixels', which makes SurfaceGuis pixel-to-pixel compatible with ScreenGuis.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.ClipsDesce.documentation: When set to true, portions of GuiObjects that fall outside of the SurfaceGui's canvas borders will not be drawn.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.Face.documentation: The face that the SurfaceGui is rendered on.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.LightInflu.documentation: Controls how much the SurfaceGui is influenced by the lighting in the game world.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.PixelsPerS.documentation: Determines the number of screen-space pixels per world-space stud used to render the contents of the SurfaceGui

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.ToolPunchT.documentation: Sets the distance left clicking starts acting on the surface gui instead of the held tool.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceGui.ZOffset.documentation: Offsets the SurfaceGui relative to the normal of the surface it is attached to.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceLight.documentation: A light source that emits illumination of a specified color and brightness from a face for a specified range.
@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceLight.code_sample:
-- Create a new BasePart
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Parent = game.Workspace
part.Anchored = true
part.Position = Vector3.new(0,0,0)

-- Create a new SurfaceLight
local light = Instance.new("SurfaceLight")
light.Color = Color3.new(255/255, 255/255, 255/255)
light.Brightness = 1
light.Range = 16
light.Parent = part

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceLight.Angle.documentation: The angle of which the light is shone from the SurfaceLight.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceLight.Face.documentation: Sets the side of the parent that the SurfaceLight comes from.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceLight.Range.documentation: The distance from the SurfaceLight's face that will illuminate.

@roblox/globaltype/SurfaceSelection.Targ.documentation: Sets which side the SurfaceSelection will appear on, on the adorned BasePart.

@roblox/globaltype/TaskScheduler.Schedul.documentation: The average time divided by the average interval of the duty cycle.
The current average rate of the task scheduler.

@roblox/globaltype/TaskScheduler.ThreadP.documentation: The specified thread pooling configuration for the task scheduler.
The current size of the thread pool.

@roblox/globaltype/Team.documentation: The Team class represents a faction in a Roblox place. The only valid parent for a Team is in the Teams service.

@roblox/globaltype/Team.AutoAssignable.documentation: This property determines whether Players will be automatically placed onto the Team when joining. If multiple teams have this property set to true, Roblox will attempt to even the teams out when Players are added.

@roblox/globaltype/Team.TeamColor.documentation: This property sets the color of the Team. Determines the Player.TeamColor property of players who are a member of the team. Also determines the color displayed on the player list and above player's heads.
@roblox/globaltype/Team.TeamColor.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")

local door = Instance.new("Part")
door.Anchored = true 
door.Size = Vector3.new(7, 10, 1)
door.Position = Vector3.new(0, 5, 0)
door.Parent = game.Workspace

local debounce = false 

door.Touched:Connect(function(hit)
	if not debounce then
		debounce = true
		if hit then
			local player = Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(hit.Parent)
			if player and player.TeamColor == BrickColor.new("Bright red") then
				door.Transparency = 0.5
				door.CanCollide = false 
				wait(3)
				door.Transparency = 0
				door.CanCollide = true
			end
		end
		wait(0.5)
		debounce = false
	end
end)

@roblox/globaltype/Team.AutoColorCharact.documentation: Deprecated and no longer functional. Historically set whether or not Player character models on a team would be colored to Team.TeamColor.

@roblox/globaltype/Team.Score.documentation: Deprecated. This property can be used to store an integer value associated with the team. This property offers no additional functionality and is not used by any game services.

@roblox/globaltype/Team.GetPlayers/param.documentation: The Team class represents a faction in a Roblox place. The only valid parent for a Team is in the Teams service.

@roblox/globaltype/Team.GetPlayers.documentation: Returns a list of Players who are assigned to the Team. A Player is considered assigned if their Player.Team property is equal to the Team and Player.Neutral is false.
@roblox/globaltype/Team.GetPlayers.code_sample:
-- count how many players are on each team
local teams = game:GetService("Teams"):GetTeams()
for _, team in pairs(teams) do
    local players = team:GetPlayers()
    print("Team " .. team.Name .. " has " .. #players .. " players")
end

@roblox/globaltype/Team.PlayerAdded.Conn.documentation: Objeto que ejecuta funciones conectadas en una incidencia específica.

@roblox/globaltype/TeleportService.GetAr.code_sample:
local TeleportService = game:GetService("TeleportService")
local Players = game:GetService("Players")
local ReplicatedFirst = game:GetService("ReplicatedFirst")

local customLoadingScreen = TeleportService:GetArrivingTeleportGui()
if customLoadingScreen then
    local playerGui = Players.LocalPlayer:WaitForChild("PlayerGui")
    ReplicatedFirst:RemoveDefaultLoadingScreen()
    customLoadingScreen.Parent = playerGui
    -- animate screen here
    wait(5)
    -- destroy screen
    customLoadingScreen:Destroy()
end

Pantalla de carga personalizada opcional que se coloca en el CoreGUI en el lugar de destino. Se puede recuperar mediante TeleportService.GetArrivingTeleportGUI.
Teletransportar un grupo de Player a un servidor reservado creado con TeleportService:ReserveServer.
@roblox/globaltype/TeleportService.Telep.code_sample:
local TS = game:GetService("TeleportService")
local Players = game:GetService("Players")
local DSS = game:GetService("DataStoreService")
local DS = DSS:GetGlobalDataStore()
 
-- Get the saved code
local code = DS:GetAsync("ReservedServer")
if type(code) ~= "string" then -- None saved, create one
	code = TS:ReserveServer(game.PlaceId)
	DS:SetAsync("ReservedServer",code)
end
 
local function Joined(plr)
	-- Everytime they chat, we want to know
	plr.Chatted:Connect(function(msg)
		if msg == "reserved" then -- Aha, that's our cue
			TS:TeleportToPrivateServer(game.PlaceId,code,{plr})
		end
	end)
end
 
-- Connect all current and future players
Players.PlayerAdded:Connect(Joined)
for k,v in pairs(Players:GetPlayers()) do
	Joined(v)
end

@roblox/globaltype/TeleportService.Telep.code_sample:
local Players = game:GetService("Players")
local TeleportService = game:GetService("TeleportService")

local placeId = 0 -- replace
local playerList = Players:GetPlayers()

local success, result = pcall(function()
    return TeleportService:TeleportPartyAsync(placeId, playerList)
end)

if success then
    local jobId = result
    print("Players teleported to "..jobId)
else
    warn(result)
end

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.documentation: A 2D user interface element that displays player-editable text

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.ClearTextOnFo.documentation: Determines whether clicking on the TextBox will clear its TextBox.Text property

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.CursorPositio.documentation: Determines the offset of the text cursor in bytes, or -1 if there is no cursor.
@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.CursorPositio.code_sample:
local textBox = script.Parent

local function showSelection()
	if textBox.CursorPosition == -1 or textBox.SelectionStart == -1 then
		print("No selection")
	else
		local selectedText = string.sub(
			textBox.Text,
			math.min(textBox.CursorPosition, textBox.SelectionStart),
			math.max(textBox.CursorPosition, textBox.SelectionStart)
		)
		print("The selection is: \"" .. selectedText .. "\"")
	end
end

textBox:GetPropertyChangedSignal("CursorPosition"):Connect(showSelection)
textBox:GetPropertyChangedSignal("SelectionStart"):Connect(showSelection)

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.Font.documentation: Determines the font used to render text

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.PlaceholderCo.documentation: Sets the text color that gets used when no text has been entered into the TextBox yet.

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.SelectionStar.documentation: Determines the starting position of a text selection, or -1 if no text is selected
@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.SelectionStar.code_sample:
local textBox = script.Parent

local function showSelection()
	if textBox.CursorPosition == -1 or textBox.SelectionStart == -1 then
		print("No selection")
	else
		local selectedText = string.sub(
			textBox.Text,
			math.min(textBox.CursorPosition, textBox.SelectionStart),
			math.max(textBox.CursorPosition, textBox.SelectionStart)
		)
		print("The selection is: \"" .. selectedText .. "\"")
	end
end

textBox:GetPropertyChangedSignal("CursorPosition"):Connect(showSelection)
textBox:GetPropertyChangedSignal("SelectionStart"):Connect(showSelection)

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.ShowNativeInp.documentation: If set to true, input native to the platform is used instead of Roblox's built-in keyboard.

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.Text.documentation: Determines the string rendered by the UI element.

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.TextBounds.documentation: The pixel size of a UI element's text.
@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.TextBounds.code_sample:
local textBox = script.Parent

-- The smallest the TextBox will go
local minWidth, minHeight = 10, 10

-- Set alignment so our text doesn't wobble a bit while we type
textBox.TextXAlignment = Enum.TextXAlignment.Left
textBox.TextYAlignment = Enum.TextYAlignment.Top

local function updateSize()
	textBox.Size = UDim2.new(
		0, math.max(minWidth, textBox.TextBounds.X),
		0, math.max(minHeight, textBox.TextBounds.Y)
	)
end

textBox:GetPropertyChangedSignal("TextBounds"):Connect(updateSize)

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.TextColor3.documentation: Determines the color of rendered text
@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.TextColor3.code_sample:
local textBox = script.Parent

local function hasVowels(str)
	return str:lower():find("[aeiou]")
end

local function onTextChanged()
	local text = textBox.Text
	-- Check for vowels
	if hasVowels(text) then
		textBox.TextColor3 = Color3.new(0, 0, 0) -- Black
	else
		textBox.TextColor3 = Color3.new(1, 0, 0) -- Red
	end
end
textBox:GetPropertyChangedSignal("Text"):Connect(onTextChanged)

textLabel.Text = "Kaboom!"

while true do

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.TextStrokeCol.documentation: Determines the color of the text stroke (outline).
@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.TextStrokeCol.code_sample:
local textLabel = script.Parent

-- How fast the highlight ought to blink
local freq = 2

-- Set to yellow highlight color
textLabel.TextStrokeColor3 = Color3.new(1, 1, 0)

while true do
	-- math.sin oscillates from -1 to 1, so we change the range to 0 to 1:
	local transparency = math.sin(workspace.DistributedGameTime*math.pi*freq)*.5+.5
	textLabel.TextStrokeTransparency = transparency
	wait()
end

@roblox/globaltype/TextBox.TextXAlignmen.code_sample:
-- Paste this in a LocalScript within a TextLabel/TextButton/TextBox
local textLabel = script.Parent

local function setAlignment(xAlign, yAlign)
	textLabel.TextXAlignment = xAlign
	textLabel.TextYAlignment = yAlign
	textLabel.Text = xAlign.Name .. " + " .. yAlign.Name
end

while true do
	-- Iterate over both TextXAlignment and TextYAlignment enum items
	for j, yAlign in pairs(Enum.TextYAlignment:GetEnumItems()) do
		for i, xAlign in pairs(Enum.TextXAlignment:GetEnumItems()) do
			setAlignment(xAlign, yAlign)
			wait(1)
		end
	end
end

@roblox/globaltype/TextButton.documentation: A 2D user interface element that displays interactive text
@roblox/globaltype/TextButton.code_sample:
-- Place this code in a LocalScript in a TextButton
local textButton = script.Parent

-- Initialize the state of the button
local counter = 0
textButton.Text = "Click me!"

-- Here, we define a function that increments the counter
-- and updates the button text after doing so
local function onActivated()
	counter = counter + 1
	textButton.Text = "Clicks: " .. counter
end

-- Connect the "Activated" event to our function
textButton.Activated:Connect(onActivated)

@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.documentation: A 2D user interface element that displays non-interactive text
@roblox/globaltype/TextLabel.code_sample:
-- Place this code in a LocalScript within a TextLabel/TextButton
local textLabel = script.Parent

-- Some colors we'll use with TextColor3
local colorNormal = Color3.new(0, 0, 0) -- black
local colorSoon = Color3.new(1, .5, .5) -- red
local colorDone = Color3.new(.5, 1, .5) -- green

-- Loop infinitely
while true do
	-- Count backwards from 10 to 1
	for i = 10, 1, -1 do
		-- Set the text
		textLabel.Text = "Time: " .. i
		-- Set the color based on how much time is left
		if i > 3 then
			textLabel.TextColor3 = colorNormal
		else
			textLabel.TextColor3 = colorSoon
		end
		wait(1)
	end
	textLabel.Text = "GO!"
	textLabel.TextColor3 = colorDone
	wait(2)
end

@roblox/globaltype/TextService.GetTextSi.documentation:
ElTextService es un servicio internamente responsable del manejo de la pantalla
de texto en el juego.
Elstring valor para el que se va a calcular el tamaño del texto.
El entero que representa elfont tamaño utilizado.
El textLabel.AbsoluteSize del objeto de texto que se va a utilizar. Requerido para calcular cómo se ajustará el texto.

The size of the space required, in pixels, by the string with the
specified formatting.
Calcula las dimensiones DataType.Vector2 (en píxeles) que se tomarán arriba con texto cuando se utilizan los parámetros de formato y el tamaño especificados restricciones.
@roblox/globaltype/TextService.GetTextSi.code_sample:
local TextService = game:GetService("TextService")

local function getTextBounds(...)
	local message = "Hello World"
	local size = Vector2.new(1,1)
    local bounds = TextService:GetTextSize(message, 12, "SourceSans", size)
    return bounds + Vector2.new(1, 1)
end

print(getTextBounds())

@roblox/globaltype/Texture.documentation: A Texture object applies a repeating texture to the face of a BasePart.

@roblox/globaltype/TimerService.documentation: An internal service responsible for scheduling timed events. It is used by the Debris class. Its functionality can not be accessed by developers.

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.documentation: Un objeto, como un arma, que puede ser equipado por un «humanoide».
@roblox/globaltype/Tool.code_sample:
local tool = script.Parent
    
    local function explode(point)
    	local e = Instance.new("Explosion")
    	e.DestroyJointRadiusPercent = 0 -- Make the explosion non-deadly 
    	e.Position = point
    	e.Parent = workspace
    end
    
    local function onActivated()
    	-- Get the Humanoid that Activated the tool
    	local human = tool.Parent.Humanoid
    	-- Call explode with the current point the Humanoid is targetting
    	explode(human.TargetPoint) 
    end
    
    tool.Activated:Connect(onActivated)

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.CanBeDropped.documentation: Controla siplayer se puede soltar la herramienta.
@roblox/globaltype/Tool.CanBeDropped.code_sample:
local tool = Instance.new("Tool")
tool.Name = "I AM CAT"
tool.RequiresHandle = false
tool.CanBeDropped = false
tool.Parent = game.Players.LocalPlayer.Backpack

tool.Activated:Connect(function()
	print("Meow")
end)

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.Enabled.documentation: Se refiere a si la herramienta se puede usar o no.
@roblox/globaltype/Tool.Enabled.code_sample:
local player = game.Players.LocalPlayer
local character = player.Character
local humanoid = character.Humanoid

local tool = Instance.new("Tool")
tool.Name = "SuperJump"
tool.RequiresHandle = false
tool.Parent = player.Backpack

local invisible = false

function toolActivated()
	humanoid.JumpPower = 150
	tool.Enabled = false
	wait(5)
	tool.Enabled = true
	humanoid.JumpPower = 50
end

tool.Activated:Connect(toolActivated)
tool.Unequipped:Connect(function() humanoid.JumpPower = 50 end)

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.Grip.documentation: AlmacenaTool las propiedades de agarre como un solo marco.
@roblox/globaltype/Tool.Grip.code_sample:
local tool = Instance.new("Tool")
tool.Name = "Stick"
tool.Parent = game.Players.LocalPlayer.Backpack

local handle = Instance.new("Part")
handle.Name = "Handle"
handle.Parent = tool
handle.Size = Vector3.new(.1,3,.1)
handle.Color = Color3.new(108, 88, 75) -- Brown

tool.Activated:Connect(function()
	print(tool.Grip)
	print(tool.GripUp)
	print(tool.GripRight)
	print(tool.GripForward)
	print(tool.GripPos)
end)

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.ManualActivation.documentation: La propiedad ManualActivationOnly controla si el Tool puede ser activado sin ejecutar Tool:Activate.
@roblox/globaltype/Tool.ManualActivation.code_sample:
local player = game.Players.LocalPlayer
local character = player.Character
local humanoid = character.Humanoid

local tool = Instance.new("Tool")
tool.Name = "Sprint"
tool.RequiresHandle = false
tool.Parent = player.Backpack

local invisible = false

function toolActivated()
	humanoid.WalkSpeed = 30
	tool.ManualActivationOnly = true
	wait(5)
	tool.ManualActivationOnly = false
	humanoid.WalkSpeed = 16
end

tool.Activated:Connect(toolActivated)
tool.Unequipped:Connect(function() humanoid.WalkSpeed = 16 end)

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.RequiresHandle.documentation: Determina si una herramienta funciona sin asa.
@roblox/globaltype/Tool.RequiresHandle.code_sample:
local tool = ...

if tool.RequiresHandle then
	print("This tool requires a handle!")
else
	print("This tool does not require a handle!")
end

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.Activate/param/0.documentation: Un objeto, como un arma, que puede ser equipado por un «humanoide».

@roblox/globaltype/Tool.Deactivate.code_sample:
local ContextActionService = game:GetService("ContextActionService")
local tool = script.Parent
 
-- Gives Handle within Tool a random BrickColor
local function toolDeactivated()
	tool.Handle.BrickColor = BrickColor.Random()
end
 
-- Deactivates the tool when any key is pressed down
local function keyPressed(actionName, actionInputState, actionInputObject)	
	if actionInputState == Enum.UserInputState.Begin then
		tool:Deactivate()
	end
end
 
tool.Deactivated:Connect(toolDeactivated)
ContextActionService:BindAction("deactivateTool", keyPressed, true, "x")

@roblox/globaltype/TouchInputService.documentation: An internal service responsible for touch inputs on mobile devices.

@roblox/globaltype/TouchTransmitter.documentation: An internal object used by networking and replication code to transmit BasePart.Touched and BasePart.TouchEnded events.
@roblox/globaltype/TouchTransmitter.code_sample:
local part = Instance.new("Part")
    part.Anchored = true 
    part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 1, 0)
    part.Parent = workspace
    
    part.Touched:Connect(function()
    	print("part touched!")
    end)
    
    local touchTransmitter = part:WaitForChild("TouchInterest")
    if touchTransmitter then
    	print("removing TouchTransmitter!")
    	touchTransmitter:Destroy()
    end

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.documentation: The Trail object is used to create a trail like effect between two points.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Attachment0.documentation: Determines where the Trail will start drawing its segments.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Attachment1.documentation: Determines where the Trail will start drawing its segments.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Color.documentation: The color of the trail segments throughout the lifetime of the trail.
@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Color.code_sample:
local trailEffect = script.Parent
  
local startColor = Color3.new(255, 0, 0)
local endColor = Color3.new(0, 0, 255)
  
local sequence = ColorSequence.new(startColor, endColor)
  
trailEffect.Color = sequence

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Enabled.documentation: Toggles whether a trail will be drawn or not.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.FaceCamera.documentation: If set to true, the trail textures will always face the camera.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Lifetime.documentation: Duration of the trail in seconds.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.LightEmission.documentation: Sets how much the colors of the trail are blended with the colors behind them.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.LightInfluence.documentation: Determines the factor to which the Trail is influenced by the environment's lighting

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.MaxLength.documentation: Sets the maximum length of the trail.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.MinLength.documentation: Minimum length of a trail's segment in studs.
@roblox/globaltype/Trail.MinLength.code_sample:
local trail = script.Parent
 
trail.Lifetime = 4
 
while wait(3) do
    trail.MinLength = 10
    wait(3)
    trail.MinLength = 0.1
end

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Texture.documentation: The texture to display on the trail.
@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Texture.code_sample:
local trail = script.Parent
local textureId = "rbxassetid://909814149"
trail.Texture = textureId

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.TextureLength.documentation: Sets length of texture if Trail.TextureMode is Wrap or Static. If mode is Stretch sets number of times texture will repeat.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.TextureMode.documentation: Sets how the Texture will be drawn.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Transparency.documentation: Sets the transparency of the Trail's segments over the trail's Trail.Lifetime.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.WidthScale.documentation: A DataType.NumberSequence that scales the width of the Trail over the course of its lifetime.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Clear/param/0.documentation: The Trail object is used to create a trail like effect between two points.

@roblox/globaltype/Trail.Clear.documentation: Clears the segments of the trail.

@roblox/globaltype/Translator.LocaleId.documentation: La configuración regional de las cadenas traducidas.

@roblox/globaltype/Translator.FormatByKe.documentation:
La función de aTranslator es fabricar/devolver cadenas localizadas para
reproductor de visualización.

Se proporcionará si el texto deFuente y las traducciones contienen formato cuerdas. Será una tabla Lua de valoresokey -pares de valores, en función de si las cadenas de formato están numeradas o nombradas.
Devuelve la cadena de texto localizada en una LocalizationTable en función de su Translator locale, porkey.

@roblox/globaltype/Translator.RobloxOnly.documentation:
La función de aTranslator es fabricar/devolver cadenas localizadas para
reproductor de visualización.

La función de aTranslator es fabricar/devolver cadenas localizadas para
reproductor de visualización.

Una Instancia válida dentro del juego para usar contextoverride como descrito anteriormente. Tenga en cuenta que este argumento puede ser arbitrario, por ejemplo juego, si no necesitas unacontext anulación.

@roblox/globaltype/Translator.Translate.documentation: Devuelve latext cadena localizada en una LocalizationTable en función de su Translator configuración regional, por búsqueda de fuente.

@roblox/globaltype/TremoloSoundEffect.documentation: Creates a trembling effect on a sound by varying the volume of the sound up and down.

@roblox/globaltype/TremoloSoundEffect.De.documentation: Controls how much the volume will raise and lower.

@roblox/globaltype/TremoloSoundEffect.Du.documentation: Controls how long during one volume oscillation the effect will be active.

@roblox/globaltype/TremoloSoundEffect.Fr.documentation: Sets how often the effect will oscillate the volume.

@roblox/globaltype/TriangleMeshPart.documentation:
Clase intermedia abstracta que gestiona las propiedades de la geometría física para
PartOperations y MeshParts.

@roblox/globaltype/TriangleMeshPart.Coll.documentation: Determina el nivel de detalle que la físicapart de's adherirá a su malla.

@roblox/globaltype/TrussPart.documentation: Truss parts are the same as Part, except that they have a different visual style, resize differently and characters are able to climb them

@roblox/globaltype/TrussPart.Style.documentation: Sets what the truss looks like. There are currently three different styles.

@roblox/globaltype/Tween.documentation: Las interpolaciones se utilizan para interpolar las propiedades de las instancias. ElTween objeto controla la reproducción de la interpolación. Creación y configuración tweens se realiza con la función TweenService.create. Esta es la única manera para crear interpolaciones. Instance.new no se puede usar para este objeto en particular.
@roblox/globaltype/Tween.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")
 
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0)
part.Color = Color3.new(1, 0, 0)
part.Anchored = true
part.Parent = game.Workspace
 
local goal = {}
goal.Position = Vector3.new(10, 10, 0)
goal.Color = Color3.new(0, 1, 0)
 
local tweenInfo = TweenInfo.new(5)
 
local tween = TweenService:Create(part, tweenInfo, goal)
 
tween:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/Tween.Instance.documentation: La propiedad Instance de solo lectura de Tween apunta a la Instancia cuyas propiedades están siendo interpoladas por la interpolación.
@roblox/globaltype/Tween.Instance.code_sample:
local function isInstanceAPart(tween)
	local instance = tween.Instance
	return instance:IsA("BasePart")
end

@roblox/globaltype/Tween.TweenInfo.documentation: Propiedad de solo lectura que incluye información sobre cómo se realiza la interpolación de el Tween se llevará a cabo utilizando el tipo de datos TweenInfo.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.documentation: Abstract base class for in-between interpolation handlers. Tween inherits from BaseTween.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.PlaybackSta.documentation: PlaybackState describes the current stage for the Tween animation. A description of each state can be found on the page for the Enum.PlaybackState enum. It can be manipulated through other Tween functions, like Tween.Play.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Cancel/para.documentation: Abstract base class for in-between interpolation handlers. Tween inherits from BaseTween.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Cancel.documentation: The Cancel function halts playback of its Tween and resets the tween variables. If TweenBase:Play is called again the Tween's properties will resume interpolating towards their destination but, as the tween variables have been reset, take the full length of the animation to do so.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Pause/param.documentation: Abstract base class for in-between interpolation handlers. Tween inherits from BaseTween.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Pause.documentation: The Pause function halts playback of its Tween. If TweenBase.Resume is called again the tween will resume playback from the moment it was paused.
@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Pause.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")
 
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0)
part.Anchored = true
part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright green")
part.Parent = game.Workspace
 
local goal = {}
goal.Position = Vector3.new(50, 10, 0)
 
local tweenInfo = TweenInfo.new(10, Enum.EasingStyle.Linear)
 
local tween = TweenService:Create(part, tweenInfo, goal)
 
tween:Play()
 
wait(3)
part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright red")
tween:Pause()
 
wait(2)
part.BrickColor = BrickColor.new("Bright green")
tween:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Play/param/.documentation: Abstract base class for in-between interpolation handlers. Tween inherits from BaseTween.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Play.documentation: The Play function starts the playback of its Tween. Note that if a tween has already begun calling Play will have no effect unless the tween has finished or has been stopped (either by TweenBase:Cancel or TweenBase:Pause).
@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Play.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")
 
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0)
part.Color = Color3.new(1, 0, 0)
part.Anchored = true
part.Parent = game.Workspace
 
local goal = {}
goal.Position = Vector3.new(10, 10, 0)
goal.Color = Color3.new(0, 1, 0)
 
local tweenInfo = TweenInfo.new(5)
 
local tween = TweenService:Create(part, tweenInfo, goal)
 
tween:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Completed.C.documentation: Objeto que ejecuta funciones conectadas en una incidencia específica.
Conecta la función dada al evento y devuelve un RBXScriptConnection que lo representa.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Completed.W.documentation:
Genera el hilo actual hasta que la señal se active y devuelva los argumentos
proporcionada por la señal.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenBase.Completed.documentation: The Completed event of a Tween fires when the tween finishes playing. This will happen either when the tween naturally finishes playing, or if it is stopped with TweenBase:Cancel.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenService.documentation: TweenServicese usa para crear Tweens, que se utilizan para interpolar, o interpolación, las propiedades de las instancias. Tweens se puede usar en cualquier objeto con tipos de propiedades compatibles.
@roblox/globaltype/TweenService.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")
 
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0)
part.Color = Color3.new(1, 0, 0)
part.Anchored = true
part.Parent = game.Workspace
 
local goal = {}
goal.Position = Vector3.new(10, 10, 0)
goal.Color = Color3.new(0, 1, 0)
 
local tweenInfo = TweenInfo.new(5)
 
local tween = TweenService:Create(part, tweenInfo, goal)
 
tween:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/TweenService.Create/p.documentation: TweenServicese usa para crear Tweens, que se utilizan para interpolar, o interpolación, las propiedades de las instancias. Tweens se puede usar en cualquier objeto con tipos de propiedades compatibles.
La Instancia cuyas propiedades se van a interpolar.
El DataType.TweenInfo que se va a usar.
Un diccionario de propiedades y sus valores objetivo que se van a interpolar.

@roblox/globaltype/TweenService.Create.documentation: Crea un nuevo Tween dado el objeto cuyas propiedades se van a interpolar, un DataType.TweenInfo y un diccionario de valores de propiedades de meta.
@roblox/globaltype/TweenService.Create.code_sample:
local TweenService = game:GetService("TweenService")
 
local part = Instance.new("Part")
part.Position = Vector3.new(0, 10, 0)
part.Color = Color3.new(1, 0, 0)
part.Anchored = true
part.Parent = game.Workspace
 
local goal = {}
goal.Position = Vector3.new(10, 10, 0)
goal.Color = Color3.new(0, 1, 0)
 
local tweenInfo = TweenInfo.new(5)
 
local tween = TweenService:Create(part, tweenInfo, goal)
 
tween:Play()

@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.documentation: Un UIComponent, que mezcla un degradado de color con su GuiObject padre, por lo que puedes poner varios colores en tutext fondo de la interfaz de usuario u otra interfaz de usuario contenido.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.Color.documentation:
Determina el color mezclado con el objeto GUIObject principal a lo largo de

@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.Enabled.documentation: Indica si el degradado está activado o no.

@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.Offset.documentation:
Determina la traslación escalar del degradado desde el centro del

@roblox/globaltype/UIGradient.Rotation.documentation:
Determina la rotación en sentido horario en grados del degradado a partir de
